subject: RE: [junit] RE: Separate Package for Test Cases or not ?
msgSnippet: Why?  What possible good does it do you to have the tests if you don t have the source to modify?  Just curious? -jason ... From: Keith Ray
messageBody:
Why? What possible good does it do you to have the tests if you don't
have the source to modify? Just curious?

-jason

-----Original Message-----
From: Keith Ray [mailto:keith.ray@...]
Sent: Monday, November 12, 2001 2:04 PM
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: [junit] RE: Separate Package for Test Cases or not ?


>That's fine for an open source project where the tests are an
>integral piece of the development process, and users may modify
>the application to suite their needs. But I don't think it's a
>very good idea in a business environment.
I'm not sure what you by a "business environment". I receive jars and
libraries (no sources) from other departments within my company, and I
would LOVE to receive the unit tests (preferably as source code, but
even without)!
Ditto for third-party libraries and jars.
